trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> class is a read-only collection generated as a response to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object that contains zero, or more, objects derived from <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.CopyTo(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse[],System.Int32)"></xref> method copies the entire collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of value where copying begins.
value is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
i is less than zero.
value is multidimensional
-or-
The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from *i* to the end of the destination value.
The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination value.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.Count"></xref> property contains the number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> objects in this collection.
The number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> objects in this collection.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.GetEnumerator"></xref> method returns an enumerator for the entire <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object for the entire collection.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.IsErrorResponse"></xref> property specifies whether an error response has occurred.
This property is `true` if an error response has occurred; `false`, otherwise.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.IsOperationError"></xref> property specifies whether an operation error response has occurred.
This property is `true` if an operation error has occurred; `false`, otherwise.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.IsSynchronized"></xref> property contains a value that indicates whether access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, `false`.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.Item(System.Int32)"></xref> property contains the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object at the specified index.
The zero-based index value at which the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object is found.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object at the specified index.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.RequestId"></xref> property contains the RequestID associated with the document.
This property is read-only and throws an exception if you attempt to set the property value.
The RequestID associated with the document.
You attempted to set the property value.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.SyncRoot"></xref> property contains an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref>.

Derived classes can provide synchronized versions of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument> using the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.SyncRoot%2A> property.

The synchronizing code must perform operations on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.SyncRoot%2A> of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument>, not directly on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument>.
This ensures proper operation of collections derived from other objects.
Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument> object.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.ToXml"></xref> method transforms each <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object in the collection into an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.
The transformed <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> object.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)"></xref> method copies the entire <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> collection to a one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.
A one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> object.
The zero-based index of value where copying begins.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.Count"></xref> property gets the number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> objects in this collection.
The number of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> objects.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref> property gets a value that indicates whether access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe).
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> is synchronized (thread-safe); otherwise, `false`.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument.System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref> property gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref>.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref>.
